comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: The not-so-good Rev was accused of killing his father-in-law!! query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F01E6DC113AE633A...

comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: This pic: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2448660225/ Is the Rev's mother & brother-in-law. Notice his mother-in-law is wearing black. Still in mourning for her husband.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Interesting article, apparently the father''s death was labeled a suicide, even though he was shot four times, and was found with his jacket buttoned and no holes in the jacket.   So he shot himself four times and then put on his jacket.  After his death, the daughter married the Rev.

comment.author: 32830507@N08
comment._content: Rev. Charles Emelius stood trial for the murder of his father-in-law C. August Jacobson but was found not guilty. Mr. Jacobson's wife and son Edgar were also tried but found not guilty. See newspaper article from Dec. 14, 1912 in The Auburn Citizen (Auburn, NY) www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&ct=res&cd=....
